title: Welcome
text:
Welcome to my website !
This website was created for 729B a class on applied Data analysis. My favorite part of the class was the introduction to the integration of Chatgpt and R. I thought this aspect was on the most helpful parts, and I will definitely bring this with me on future projects.

title: Chatgpt Integration
text:
library(stargazer)


Please cite as: 


 Hlavac, Marek (2022). stargazer: Well-Formatted Regression and Summary Statistics Tables.


 R package version 5.2.3. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=stargazer 

library(chatgpt)
library(rvest)
library(httr)
library(jsonlite)
library(stringr)
library(tidyverse)

library(readxl)
ERP_F <- read_excel("ERP.F.xls")

EERP <- ERP_F

q1b <- EERP$bidend

q1b <- as.numeric(q1b)   

q2b <- EERP$bident

q2b <- as.numeric(q2b)



q3b <- EERP$bidenrm

q3b <- as.numeric(q3b)


q4b <- EERP$bidenf

q4b <- as.numeric(q4b)

q5b <- EERP$bidenp

q5b <- as.numeric(q5b)

q6b <- EERP$bidende

q6b <- as.numeric(q6b)

q7b <- EERP$bidenlm

q7b <- as.numeric(q7b)

q8b <- EERP$bidentr

q8b <- as.numeric(q8b)

q9b <- EERP$bidenap

q9b <- as.numeric(q9b)

EERP$index <- q1b + q2b + q3b + q4b + q5b + q6b + q7b + q8b + q9b

index <- EERP$index

VoteBiden <- EERP$vcbiden

VoteBiden <- as.numeric(VoteBiden)

VoteBiden <- ifelse(VoteBiden >3,1,0)

PSSRJ <- index

race <- EERP$race
pid <- EERP$pid

my_API <- "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"

hey_chatGPT <- function(answer_my_question) {
  chat_GPT_answer <- POST(
    url = "https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions",
    add_headers(Authorization = paste("Bearer", my_API)),
    content_type_json(),
    encode = "json",
    body = list(
#      model = "gpt-3.5-turbo-0301",
       model = "gpt-3.5-turbo-0301",
        messages = list(
        list(
          role = "user",
          content = answer_my_question
        )
      )
    )
  )
  content(chat_GPT_answer)
}



Bidenmodel <- glm(VoteBiden ~ PSSRJ + race + pid, family = binomial (link = "probit"))



stargazer(Bidenmodel, type = "text", title = "Please interpret these results, my dependent variable is if a person voted for biden, and my independent is the PSSRJ model. PSSRJ measures the parasocial relationship between Joe Biden and voters. Also discuss why the results are what they are and why this matters for the worl ", out = "tablebiden.htm") 


Please interpret these results, my dependent variable is if a person voted for biden, and my independent is the PSSRJ model. PSSRJ measures the parasocial relationship between Joe Biden and voters. Also discuss why the results are what they are and why this matters for the worl
=============================================
                      Dependent variable:    
                  ---------------------------
                           VoteBiden         
---------------------------------------------
PSSRJ                      -0.049***         
                            (0.007)          
                                             
race                        -0.069*          
                            (0.040)          
                                             
pid                        0.391***          
                            (0.067)          
                                             
Constant                    0.693**          
                            (0.303)          
                                             
---------------------------------------------
Observations                  483            
Log Likelihood             -251.559          
Akaike Inf. Crit.           511.118          
=============================================
Note:             *p<0.1; **p<0.05; ***p<0.01

question2<-html_text(read_html("tablebiden.htm")) 
ask_2 <- hey_chatGPT(question2)
str_trim(ask_2$choices[[1]]$message$content)

character(0)



tq1 <- EERP$dtap 

tq1 <- as.numeric(tq1)

tq2 <- EERP$dtt

tq2 <- as.numeric(tq2)

tq3 <- EERP$dtlm 

tq3 <- as.numeric(tq3)

tq4 <- EERP$dtde

tq4 <-as.numeric(tq4)

tq5 <- EERP$dtgp

tq5 <- as.numeric(tq5)


tq6 <- EERP$dtf

tq6 <- as.numeric(tq6)


tq7 <- EERP$dtrm 


tq7 <- as.numeric(tq7)

tq8 <- EERP$dtd

tq8 <- as.numeric(tq8)

tq9 <- EERP$dtp 

tq9 <- as.numeric(tq9)


dtindex <- tq1 + tq2 + tq3 + tq4 + tq5 + tq6 + tq7 + tq8 + tq9


PSSRD <- dtindex


VoteTrump <- EERP$vctrump

VoteTrump1 <- as.numeric(VoteTrump)

VoteTrump1 <- ifelse(VoteTrump1 >3,1,0)



Trumpmodel <- glm(VoteTrump1 ~ PSSRD + race + pid, family = binomial (link = "probit"))

stargazer(Trumpmodel, type = "text", title = "Parasocial Relationships and Vote for Trump", out = "PSSR_Table.htm")


Parasocial Relationships and Vote for Trump
=============================================

                  ---------------------------

---------------------------------------------

                            (0.010)          
                                             
race                       -0.107**          
                            (0.052)          
                                             
pid                        -0.183**          
                            (0.089)          
                                             
Constant                   3.861***          
                            (0.337)          
                                             
---------------------------------------------
Observations                  486            
Log Likelihood             -119.098          
Akaike Inf. Crit.           246.196          
=============================================
Note:             *p<0.1; **p<0.05; ***p<0.01

stargazer(Trumpmodel, type = "text", title = "Please interpret these results, my dependent variable is if a person voted for Trump, and my independent is the PSSRD model. PSSRD measures the parasocial relationship between donald Trump and voters. Also discuss why the results are what they are and why this matters for the world", out = "tabletrump.htm")

title: chatgptplugin
text: In this section I want to show how I am using chatgpt for my own research project.

title: My Research
text: My research interest are race and ethnic politics. For this project I argue that the parasocial relationship created between politicians and voters is salient and understudied. I argue that politicians form bonds with voters over things that have nothing to do with politics. I also argue that this is because voters are not paying attention to policy and cannot remember three policy concerns that is tackled by their congress member. As a result, voters remember how they feel about a candidate and I argue that this can translate into vote choice. Preliminary evidence has shown that strong parasocial bonds lead to strong support for candidates. However, I am hoping to take this a step further and see if stronger parasocial bonds can help voters make a decision at the polls over traditional measures such as likeability.

title: About Me
text:
Hi my name is Jordan Spencer and I am a PhD student at the University of Maryland.
In my free time I like the exercise, talk with friends and eat good food.
